result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Henry D Mayes was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Henry D Mayes was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Dane County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: IID restriction effective upon licensure for 30 mo.

miscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $1569  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.

Defendant shall not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL and approval of agent & IID.

Sobrietor recommended.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

timeConds.notes:
WIth huber. Credit does NOT apply. Provisions of 973.09(1)(d) (Good Time) apply.

All other conditions are the same as count 1 (except jail time).

records.addlTxt:
to stay jail sentence and order. 
Crt orders that the jail sentence is stayed beginning at 7 am on 6/4/16 until 7 am on 6/7/16. Consumption of alcohol is prohibited.  Amended Judgment of Conviction prepared.

Based on financial information provided to the Court by the defendant, the Court has found that the defendant's household income is no more than 150% of the federal nonfarm poverty guideline.
Therefore it is Ordered that an Ignition Interlock Device (IID) shall be installed and maintained for 50% of the normal costs.
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Judgment of conviction prepared.

Referral to DCBM
Reporter:  Jeanette Sundstrom;  Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail amended.

- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $1000.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. tomorrow.
  If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.  
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.

AMENDED TO CASH BOND  -  EFFECTIVE ON TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 8, 2015 - REFERRAL TO BMP   
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $800 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his release from jail.  
- If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $2,000 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
- Defendant shall not consume alcohol.  
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle.
